instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
Ok so I got this with quarter fan spin and it went straight to dim green light after a few minutes of diode measurements. With just the charger plugged in. 
pp3v42 = 3.42
Ppbus_g3h = 0.3v
Diode mode ppbus_g3h=.489

R7020 pin1=2.4v [HR][/HR]R7021 pins 1 & 2 in ohms = 1.965 k ohms
R7022 pins 1 & 2 in ohms = 1.975 k ohms
R7022 between pins 1 & 2 =0.1
C7020 resistance on 1&2 =20ohms 

Isl6295 (pins)27/28 20ohms
Isl6295 (pins)17/18 2.9ohms
Smc_reset_L =3.3v

Q7085 Pins 1-4=16.24v
Q7085 ppdcin_g3h_inrush =2.59v

Tried with battery g3h=12.5v at fuse f7040

thank you for your time

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message: Ok thanks. I?ll get back to you when I get home

14-smc_bc_acok=140mv

18-chrg_cso_p=380mv

27-chrg_csi_p=.7mv

im sorry I just wanted to give all the info that I could :( thank you for your time and effort resolving this issue. I know the boards are old. I know they?re worth nothing but I?m taking this opportunity to add to my repair knowledge. Hopefully I will be able to return your kindness in the future thank you and the community:)

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
"3-chrg_acin=1.5mv"
There should be aprox 4V.

"19-pp5v1_chrg_vdd=6mv
20-pp5v1_chrg_vddp=6mv"
And 5V there.

So start checking diode mode (red probe at ground) on these points.
If nothing strange, then check R7010; could be open, because of corrosion.

No datasheet available for ISL6259.
But the other charger chips do not generate VDD untill ACIN is correct.
Is supposed to be valid for this one too...

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
"r7011 =38ohms in circuit"
Remove C7011.
If works, you are lucky; not even need to change it.
If not, change ISL6259.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
C7011 is not critical, let it out.
But need to replace R7011, seems to be bad.
Or maybe broken/corroded trace.
You should get aprox 4V there.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message: Good morning soo I replaced the isl6529 before I saw your comment. The isl was shorted on pin 3 now I have 3.9 at acin. The light was dim even after the change and now checking around the mosfet I heard a ?click? and the MagSafe light turned a normal green and ppbus_g3h had 12.5v then died again. Bad solder joint ? Or MOSFET ?

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
"The isl was shorted on pin 3 now I have 3.9 at acin"
You had just a bad C7011.

Bad solders, or knocked off components around ISL6259 could now generated more damage on the board.

Did you solder good R7011???

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message: Yes I did solder it well. I have 4v at the voltage divider. I tried without c7011 it gave me 16v at pin3. I replaced it with another c7011. are you saying I switched isl 6529 for no good reason? :(

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message: Now after I changed isl6259 I have 4v at pin 3 I looked around all the components are still in their place I?ve double checked.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message: I noticed R7086 pin2 has 12v at chrg_agate and Nothing on output Ppdcin_g3h_inrush at q7085

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
If ACIN went high removeing C7011, ISL6259 was not the culprit.

"I have 4v at the voltage divider. I tried without c7011 it gave me 16v at pin3"
This is very confuse.
You can only get 16V there if R7011 is open, or not soldered.
C7011 is not involved in voltage level; can only short to ground if bad.

I?m sorry for the confusion its me. I fixed some corrosion on the edge of the board that I hadn?t seen.  I have a solid green light on MagSafe  and I believe that isl is pulling chrg_agate high to 15v because it might be seeing some over current at chrg_csip and chrg_csip.I noticed that at the mosfet upper mosfet by isl I have a weird fluctuation. So I removed f7040 put my power supply on 12v and placed it on pin 2 of f7040 so that should now rule out anything on isl as being an issue am I right? If not. I have still divided the system in half and know the issue is after pin2 on f7040
thank you

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
Post diode mode on PPBUS_G3H power rail.
Check all resistors around ISL6259 for proper values.
Post again the same voltages for U7000 above mentioned.
Also exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

Be sure to have good solders!

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.

Thank you your guidance help me find the culprit. I found the issue with fluctuations on g3h it was r7005.

so now I?m back on the fan spinning for 20 sec and stopping the usb mouse and usb stick flash when the fan spins and stops when the fan stops. G3h is stable 12.53v  and 5v pulses with power on off

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
If you hold the power button down when it is doing this, does it start up normally? 


My very first board repair would do this, and you held the power button down, and it would start normally, ended up being a bad ISL. 

Had another machine that would do this, and power on normally if the power button was held, and it was a short on a trackpad subrail. 

Try it and report results. If the same, check for a short on S0 and S3 rails.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
If the USB stick flashes, means the board is working in that time.
Check if board stays on if you start in SMC bypass mode.
Be sure heatsink is properly fixed and CPU/GPU don't get overheat fast.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
This will likely suck. 

Recheck current sensing on pins 17/18 27/28 of the ISL should be 3-5 ohms / 20 ohms. 

Also, resistance to ground on CPU and GPU VCORE.

That reminds me. Are you using a real 85w charger with this? 

When the fan spins, does PLT_RESET_L go high?

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
"the fan spinning for 20 sec"
Why do you talk about pulsing now?
I was waiting to get some voltages present in the 20s mentioned.
You cannot say pulsing when the board stays on 20s; unless you note some pulse in these 20s...

BTW, C9560 shouldn't be related with this symptom, but it must be changed in any case.
So change it now, to discard it completely.
Do NOT use hot air for this!

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
im sorry What I meant was that the pulsing coincides with fan on and off or at the same time
the coils as I mentioned only showed a voltage L7330
it goes up to 3.3v then to zero. So when fan spins it at 3.3v when off it goes to zero the only other rail I found that does this is ppv1v5_s3 and gets power from pp3v3_s3 which isn?t pulsing on off it stays stable all the time.

threads.title: 820-2850 dim green light.
threads.message:
If fan spins, 5V_S0 is needed.
PLEASE post accurate information.
There are more voltages present for sure.
To get 5V_S0, PPBUS_G3H is required, as 3V3_S5 too.

BTW, ALWAYS check coils voltage on the pin connected to filter capacitor.

Check traces and resistors around U7400.
